oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: John Wade correspondence with Lula Ulrica Whitaker, 1934 March 8
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wade, John Donald, 1892-1963
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from John Wade to Lula Ulrica Whitaker expressing his opinion that the Agrarian movement has progressed and attesting to his personal practice of Argrarian principles, including owning and operating farms "chiefly for the privilege of paying taxes on them."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Agrarians (Group of writers); American literature -- Southern States; American literature -- Southern States -- History and criticism; Southern States -- Intellectual life -- 1865-
Wade, John Donald, 1892-1963
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Lula Ulrica Whitaker correspondence with Southern Agrarians, 1934-1935
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Lula Ulrica Whitaker Southern Agrarian Writers correspondence
